comment: She's a nice lady and really tries. She offers a lot of help outside of class as well. But in all seriousness this is the worst professor I have ever seen in my entire academic career. She does not understand students' questions and cannot explain any concepts to save her life. Take literally anyone else.

She constantly contradicts herself. She will tell you to do one thing, then get mad and tell you to do the opposite. She takes off points for seemingly no reason. She tells different groups different information. You sometimes have to wait over thirty minutes to leave the lab because she takes so long signing people off to leave. Massive headache.

She's an easy grader, especially on exams. There were only 3 plus the final, and had super simple questions, but that's about all that was enjoyable in the class. There were 23 lecture quizzes, 8 chapter quizzes, and 8 homeworks. They were all super simple, but the time added up. Her lectures were unbearable yet attendance was a grade.

DO NOT TAKE

Sabina is one of the worst professors I have ever had for a lab. She was so unorganized and wasted so much of our time. She was never prepared which caused the class to have to completely redo a lab. She never graded our lab reports until the very end so we could not improve our writing or lab manuals.
She is so sweet! Go to class, understand the lectures, do the homework and you will do well. She offers extra credit every week. Cares a lot about student success

Shahnaz is an amazing professor, though she talks a lot in a lecture. She gives detailed lectures that can be tied to her tests, her quizzes are open-note, and she is willing to answer any student questions about the topic. Attendance is mandatory and missing enough classes can deduct points from your grade. There is homework but it is not much.

Having been a freshman taking this as my first engineering class. I honestly believe she is an amazing lecturer. She is very knowledgeable in the subject. Idk why her rating on here is low. Exams reflected on lecture problems, But only 2 exams besides the final. Limited accessibility out of class. Attend class, Do HW on time, you'll get an easy A.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Her lectures are extremely boring, which caused me to skip half of her classes. She struggles to properly explain the conventions for the middle chapters (4-6), which makes them extremely tedious. I learned more about Statics by figuring it out myself and not going to her classes, which doesn't work for most people. Avoid her for anything else.

Good lectures. Tells you exactly what will be on the tests. Homework is hard and worth very little but she posts the answers before it is due. Lots of class problems that are very similar to test. If you come to most classes, she will boost grade at the end of the year. Very nice.

ENGR 3343 is not an easy course. Shahnaz knows her stuff and is good at portraying that to students. I felt prepared for the final even though its a department final and not made by the professor. She is great at answering questions and reviewing difficult topics. Only issue is she stops class to get upset at something a student is doing.
Absolutely awful, avoid at all costs.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: She's nice, but save yourself the stress and disappointment by taking someone else.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: strengths lab is a joke in terms of difficulty, as long as you understand the formulas from the lecture. I would consider the professor a solid choice as long as you take the class just as seriously as she takes it. Show up prepared! Know everything about the lab before you get there!

She has a poor rating but is much better than she gets repped for. She gives pop quizzes for extra points (a fail or pass wont lower overall grade) and they are always over her PowerPoints. I felt prepared for all of her tests by reading her posted PowerPoints and doing the hw.

Please do yourself a favor and avoid this professor. She cannot explain the concepts she teaches. She raises her voice at the class until the people in the back listen. (it takes time and attention away from those who are paying attention) She teaches at a very slow and repetitive pace, causing her to fall behind her own schedule. Exams are easy.
Horrible explainer. Tough grader but gives lots of extra credit.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: She's a wonderful person putside of class, but a terrible Statics Prof.   reads another profs notes as "lectures", and just reads the book publishers PowerPoint.  Limited availability outside of class, but willing to help if you can catch her.  Super confusing scheduling, only prof I've ever had make more than one change to syllabus. DONT TAKE.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Unfortunately cannot give below a 1 for this professor. Would probably give a negative rating. Avoid at all costs

Assigns the project at the last minute during the semester. Doesn't give any feedback before withdrawal deadline. Takes weeks to grade one assignment. Have to beg to get assignments back before tests. Have to beg for information on the project and help for the project. Never accessible outside of class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: 3/4 of the homework has been assigned in the last 3 weeks. She has sped through some very critical material at the last part of the semester because she spent so long on the first 2 lectures. She reads directly from another teachers notes and cannot definitively answer students questions. Would not recommend this professor for any class!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Worst professor I have ever had at KSU. She doesn't have any background in concrete and clearly doesn't know what she is doing. If you want help outside of class from her, good luck! She barely ever lets anyone past the door.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: the worst teacher i have ever had. showed up 30mins late on test day and yelled at a student asking for time on the test (she ran out when time was up. period.) exam was another teachers, with material not covered yet in the class, the whole class failed. she knows nothing, has no experience and has an attitude. i just hope she passes us at the end

On top of all the complaints I alrdy have about this prof,I got a new one. Do u remember when Reggie Bush won the Heisman in 05, he would stiff arm defenders almost identicaly to the Heisman trophy itself! Exctly what you'll get when you try to meet with this Prof in her office. Quick to make you leave! W/out any answers,like ur invading her pri...

Reads straight from lecture. if your broke and you can't afford the book or chegg you aren't going to learn anything, because her lectures are no help. She has no background on the subject matter and you better find other professors that may help. Good luck, seriously.

She does not have a concrete background, and doesn't know concrete. She reads of off another teachers slides and copies it to the board. Hard for her to teach what she doesn't know. tests are hard due to the fact they are not like anything you have seen before. Doesn't give enough HW to learn, and is not clear on what the exam material is.

She is not a very good professor avoid at all costs. She is impossible to understand at all, if you take her class you will be teaching yourself everything, Also with her the final was impossible the average grade for our class on the final was an 55%. She can not teach she just reads of the slides. She also forgot to give final grades on time.

ok Professor for Fluid Mechanics, she is hard to understand sometimes, the highest test grade is curved to a 100. She is a new professor here. Study all chapters which was covered in class on your own time and you will do good in the class.
